result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Loryn Ashley Piklor

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Loryn Ashley Piklor
Current: 521 A N 4th Ave, Redgranite, WI 54970 United States  (Effective: 05-26-2017)
Prior: 213 N Madison St, Coloma, WI 54930

2:34 pm case called. Defendant Loryn Ashley Piklor in court with attorney David C. Rashid.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement stated on record by ADA Anderson. Attorney Rashid & defendant concur.     Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant. Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained.  Consequences explained for failure to abide by terms of PPDA. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1. Court accepts plea and stays JOC.  Court accepts terms and conditions of PPDA.  Matter stayed for 12 months. Court dismisses and reads-in Count 2. Court makes a statement regarding bond to defendant.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Loryn Ashley Piklor in court with attorney David C. Rashid. Atty Rashid appears by phone.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Rashid requesting another STC.  Status conference scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 01:40 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney David C. Rashid in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Rashid makes a statement-has received offer-needs to discuss with client. Requests additional status.  Status conference scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.   Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

Case Called @ 1:50 PM: Defendant Loryn Ashley Piklor in court, appearing pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel - currently not employed.  Def referred to SPD for eligibility process.  To meet with SPD today prior to leaving the building.  ADA argues for Signature Bond of $1000 w/conditions.  No statement by Def as to bond request.  NGP entered by Court.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 10:35 am.
Return of Search Warrant, Search Warrant, Application for Search Warrant, Search Warrant Return - 213 N Madison St, Village of Coloma, Waushara County - Thomas Goddard & Loryn Piklor
